Casual Customer Sales & Service Consultant Doncaster, Eastland, Knox

Company Name Telstra Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 7 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Connect with Telstra

We’re at the heart of technological change and we’re helping to make it happen by connecting everything to everyone. And that’s where you come in, to help us create a brilliantly connected future for our customers.

About The Role

We are seeking expressions of interest from talented individuals who thrive in a fast paced customer service environment and are looking for their next career opportunity. Our Expression of Interest is extended to our Doncaster, Eastland & Knox Telstra stores.

At Telstra, we know that our people are our greatest asset and that’s why we’re always looking for brilliant individuals who embody our values and have a passion for technology.

As part of our Customer Sales and Service Consultants team, you will be the face and voice of Telstra. Talking to our new and existing customers, you’ll deliver personalised service and advice to uncover their individual needs and provide them with great solutions.

On any given day, you could be sharing your knowledge about our services and the latest technology, or talking to a customer about our international roaming offers for their next holiday. It’s challenging and varied work that you can be proud of.

What You’ll Bring

As our customers are at the heart of everything we do, their happiness is our success, so you’ll need to go above and beyond to meet their needs.

This means we’re looking for people who have the confidence to speak with customers face to face, are resourceful and resilient, and are able to show us their natural enthusiasm for working with people.

You'll also need to be receptive to different personalities, and use varied approaches in your interactions with others.

No previous technical knowledge is required, just your passion for people and learning, as we’ll provide you with all the training you’ll need.

Sounds like you?

If you have a passion for retail and can deliver a unique, memorable experience to our customers every time they enter our store – a job at Telstra is for you!

We’re committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce. To enable everyone to participate, we’ve developed an ‘All Roles Flex’ policy to consider flexible ways of working for every role. To learn more, visit

  • Online Media
  • Telecommunications

837583724:
[

Casual Teacher - Migrant English

Company Name Swinburne University of Technology Company Location Hawthorn, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 4 days ago Number of views 152 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Swinburne is a progressive university that aims to increase Australia’s capacity in science, technology and innovation as the drivers of modern, internationalised economies and workplaces. Our university is focused on high-impact global research, high-quality teaching and active engagement with both industry and the community.

About the department
Swinburne’s Pathways to Vocational Education has five departments, which offer vocational programs at post-graduate, advanced diploma, diploma, certificate and basic vocational levels.

The Health & Science Department incorporates the following program areas:

• Early Childhood and Education
• Nursing and Health Services
• Community Services
• Laboratory Technologies and Science
• Migrant English
• General Education

About the job
The Swinburne PAVE Teacher is required to inspire, engage and educate our students for the 21st century. A PAVE teacher will implement industry best practice and apply current learning technologies and contemporary learning pedagogies. The PAVE teacher will work collaboratively within a team of education professionals. Within this team environment, they will plan deliver, assess, evaluate and ensure compliance of high quality education and training programs. This role requires our teachers to be able to customise and adapt our programs to meet our learners and clients’ needs that vary from certificate level through to diploma and associate degree levels.

About you
To be successful in the role, you will have:

  • Certificate IV in Training and Assessment (TAE40110 or its successor)
  • Post Graduate qualification in Teaching English to Speakers of other Languages (TESOL) or equivalent.
  • Demonstrated experience or the capacity to develop learning and assessment resources.

A full list of the selection criteria is available within the position description

Benefits\xa0
The diverse culture within Swinburne is a source of strength. We have an inclusive working environment with employees from a variety of backgrounds. We acknowledge that diversity in the university workforce increases the effectiveness of teams and our capacity for innovation. We welcome applications from Indigenous people, workers of all ages, people with disabilities, people who identify as LGBTIQ and those from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds.

We are proud to be recognised by the Workplace Gender Equality Agency as an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality 2018 and of key initiatives such as our Pride@Swinburne Strategic Action Plan and our Reconciliation Action Plan which are integral components of our 2025 vision to be world class university creating social and economic impact through science, technology and innovation. Swinburne has also received the Victorian “High Commendation” Multicultural Excellence Award (Business Category).

Further information, contacts and support
To start an application click on 'begin' at the bottom of this page and submit a resume, cover letter and response to the Key Selection Criteria, as listed in the Position Description below.
Please do not email or send paper applications, all applications must be submitted online.

For further information about the position, please contact (full name, position title on telephone number).

If you are experiencing technical difficulties with your application, please contact the Recruitment team on staffrecruitment@swin.edu.au

Should you require further support for an interview due to special needs or consideration, please contact our Diversity Consultant, Dr. Walter Robles, on inclusion@swin.edu.au, or our Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Employment Officer, Sherrin Trautmann on DeadlyCareers@swin.edu.au.

Applications close at 11.30pm, Sunday 30th September 2018.

For further details on How to Apply, including Hints & Tips, please refer to our Frequently Asked Questions section.

Customer Experience (CX) Lead

Company Name AKQA Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 51 views

Job description

At AKQA, we believe in the imaginative application of art and science to create beautiful ideas, products and services. With an entrepreneurial and collaborative approach, we design adaptive digital services and applications that capture the imagination, delivering impressive returns for our clients.


As the Customer Experience (CX) Lead in AKQA’s Melbourne studio, you’ll lead the CX team and projects for a major national retail client, delivering digital and multi-channel experiences of the highest possible quality. You’ll innovate and collaborate to create customer-centric solutions that impress our clients in imaginative new ways. \xa0


At AKQA, you’ll work in a meritocratic culture surrounded by some of the brightest minds in their fields. You’ll have the opportunity to learn and grow within a creative and technically advanced team, with access to ongoing personal and professional development. At AKQA, we’re committed to your career growth, as well as your work/life balance.

\xa0


RESPONSIBILITIES:


  • Set the highest standard for CX projects; leading by example, developing and inspiring your team, collaborating and presenting to clients with confidence.
  • Plan and manage CX projects end-to-end, ensuring the requisite processes and resources are in place for successful delivery and exceptional client results.
  • Collaborate with junior CX practitioners and client service teams to deliver customer-focused projects that meet client needs in creative and impressive ways.
  • Lead with a growth mindset, developing CX team members’ knowledge and skills by challenging and stretching them, whilst always maintaining quality standards.
  • Cultivate a positive and proactive team culture that strives to deliver exceptional work and continuously improve, whilst acknowledging and celebrating success.
  • Present the latest CX trends and methodologies in an engaging manner, at times as the lead consultant, to deliver innovative solutions that surprise and delight.
  • Align creative and technology with client needs and business objectives, identify and convert commercially viable opportunities, and create case studies for growth.
  • Keep the wider agency informed, focused and enthused about the progress of individual projects and the business as a whole.

\xa0


SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS:


  • Proven CX project delivery experience, particularly with large scale/complex projects delivered against commercial requirements.
  • Strong technical knowledge of digital and multi-channel CX strategy, measurement frameworks, mapping, data collection and analysis, statistical analysis, ethnography and other critical CX research, analysis and review methodologies.
  • Exceptional leadership skills that enable you to quickly earn client and internal team confidence.
  • Excellent communication and presentation style for managing client expectations, facilitating workshops, and conducting stakeholder and customer interviews.
  • Enthusiastic, solution-focused attitude, with the determination to find the best outcome for all projects.

\xa0


AKQA is an Equal Opportunities Employer, we believe that diversity is vital to AKQA’s ability to provide our clients with the best recommendations and are committed to fostering a varied and inclusive work environment. Your race, colour, ancestry, religion, gender, gender identity, national origin, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability or veteran status have no bearing on our hiring decisions. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

IBX Field Engineer II

Company Name Equinix Company Location Derrimut, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 15 views

Job description

IBX Field Engineer II
Are you passionate about technology? Want to kick start your career within a leading global organisation? Our hands on role as a Data Centre Technician might be the role for you.

Who are we?

Equinix is the one of the largest growing Data Centre companies, growing connectivity between clients worldwide. That’s why we're always looking for creative and visionary people who can help us achieve our goal – global interconnection. With over 200 datacentres in over 24 countries spanning across 5 continents, we are home of the Cloud, supporting over 1000 Cloud and IT services companies that are directly engaged in technological innovation and development. We are passionate about further evolving the specific areas of software development, software and network architecture, network operations, and complex cloud and application solutions

The Role

As a Datacentre Technician, you will be part of a team that is at the core of our Equinix Operations department, providing 7/24/365 support to the Datacentre and conducting circuit maintenance, installations and advanced testing. You will also be responsible for the daily upkeep and operations.

Responsibilities

Installations
  • Installs ladder racks and fiber raceways
  • Builds/Installs cages
  • Installs cable management/support systems to include vertical wire managers, horizontal wire managers, and patch panels
  • Performs intra-cage and infrastructure installations
  • Installs and grounds cabinets and two-post racks
Queue Management
  • Escalates SRs that require additional information
  • Testing/Troubleshooting
  • Conducts carrier circuit testing
  • Cross Connects
  • Installs/Tests/Modifies cross connects per SOPs and ensures proper cable management of: coax, fiber, twisted pair copper, and intra-building cross connects
Documentation/Reporting
  • Maintains accurate notes and records of activity fulfillment in ticketing system
  • Projects
  • Supports fulfillment of projects with direction from senior staff
Training
  • Completes all assigned training in a timely manner
  • Customer Management
  • Supports customer satisfaction through timely and precise orders

Requirements/Qualifications
  • 1+ years working experience
  • Willingness to work a 24/7 shift rota that includes day and night shifts
  • A keen interest in data centres, IT, or engineering etc.
  • Strong Customer Service Skills
  • Ability to work effectively as part of a team is essential

Are you interested? Click apply now!

You can also check out our YouTube page to find out more about us: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC9xshmMk-FKjqKCLOKklQQw

Equinix is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, colour, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with disabilities

Mid-Senior Developers

Company Name GlobalX Company Location Melbourne CBD, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 37 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About the Role


We are searching for Senior Software Engineers who want to create brilliant software that improves our customer's workflows. As a team member in one of our SCRUM teams, you will use your experience to help your team understand the problem domain and then create innovative solutions that are easy to use, fast, resilient, secure and maintainable. You will provide guidance to your peers within your team and also across our other six SCRUM teams.
\xa0

In this role\xa0you’ll


  • Work with our Product Owners (and our Customers!) to understand and be a core part of the team that delivers our Customer’s goals
  • \xb7Be a full stack engineer and use techniques like user story mapping, BDD, emergent architecture, pair programming and automated testing to build software.
  • Mentor your peers in areas that you are strong in and they are not
  • \xa0 Be mentored in areas your peers are strong in and you are not
  • Aim for daily or weekly product release cycles, not monthly or quarterly
  • Be supported by the business in making brave decisions
  • Listen and participate in Guilds specializing in things like Angular, React, Asynchronous programming, or start your own!
  • Be part of a creative culture that focuses on continuous improvement of the features we release as well as the way in which we create those features



About You


We’re looking for engineers who are motivated to continuously improve the quality of their work. Engineers who know that a cooperative SCRUM team is worth far more than the sum of its parts. You might not have all of the below, but if you have most of them – Woot!


  • Your excellent communication skills are reflected in the code you write and in your interactions with your team, stakeholders and customers.
  • Strong in SOLID engineering principles (We use .NET Core but if you’re SOLID in Java that will do just fine)
  • Strong in asynchronous programming or event driven programming
  • Strong in AngularJS, Angular 2+, or React/ReactNative
  • Strong in RESTful API Composition, Hypermedia APIs (HAL, Collection+Json, JSON API)
  • Strong in Container technologies like Docker and Container management tools like Kubernetes.

\xa0

About Us


Each day, thousands of professionals rely on GlobalX's suite of market-leading solutions to make profitable decisions and effectively manage their matters in a way that allows them to do more, in less time – and to do it better than their competitors.

\xa0

Since establishment as the first company to make Australian land titles available to the consumer online in 1994, GlobalX has maintained a reputation as an industry leader that offers robust, yet refined innovation and quality conveyancing and legal support services.

\xa0

GlobalX received the ABA100 awards for Digital Innovation and Technology Innovation for its software offerings; Matter Centre, IDSecure and SignMe.

\xa0

Applying


We want to know about what you think quality code means. As part of your application, please include a cover letter that includes your answer to this question; “What is quality code?”

Technical Consultant

Company Name Quintiq, a Dassault Syst\xe8mes company Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 81 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Imagine New Horizons

You have dreams? You enjoy a challenge? Here at Dassault Syst\xe8mes, we empower people and energize passion to change the world and create the future. Let's open new horizons together with the power of 3DEXPERIENCE virtual universes!

 #career # Scheduling #Consultant #Dassault Systemes #Quintiq

What will your role be?

Based in our Melbourne office, this critical role will ensure technical success of our QUINTIQ projects on all aspects of integration, scalability, performance and security.

This opportunity will suit an experienced technology enthusiast who has a natural affinity with how software works. A Quintiq Technical Consultant is someone with superior technical and analytical skills who is confident in facing customers in a consultancy role. It is expected that you have a broad understanding of diverse range of enterprise software (ERPs, DMS, middleware, MSSQL / Oracle databases, AD, etc) and hardware (physical and VM) used by our customers.

Collaborating with tier 1 companies and our internal project team, and your job is to workshop and understand the technical as well as relevant business requirements of the client, then propose software and integration architectures as well as specify hardware requirements. You will have had proven experience in articulating this vision to the client, and guide them through successful implementation of QUINTIQ.

You will be involved at every stage of a project, from providing technical expertise and knowledge about the Quintiq technology during the presales cycle, through delivery of the solution and to supporting some post go-live issues.

Your Responsibilities Include
  • Work as the single point of technical contact from Quintiq during projects to recommend to customers the implementation and deployment architecture of Quintiq solutions, including proposals of hardware requirements
  • Ensure the integration success of a Quintiq implementation
  • Ensure the performance and scalability success of a Quintiq implementation
  • Ensure the success of the authorization and authentication aspects of a Quintiq implementation
  • Provide technical and integration consultation to customers and partners regarding their Quintiq implementation
  • Troubleshoot and identify root causes of technical (non-functional) issues in projects in a structured analytical manner
  • Collaborate with R&D to diagnose, troubleshoot and document technical issues relating to the Quintiq software
  • Collaborate with customers to manage Quintiq environments
  • Develop best practices and procedures to streamline software deployments
  • Make recommendations for optimizing Quintiq software performance
  • Contribute to answering RFI/RFP

Job description

Company Description

Vlocity is a fast-growing enterprise applications company focused on bringing industry-specific business processes to the cloud. With 400 employees around the world and customers on six continents, Vlocity has been the fastest-growing independent software vendor on the Salesforce platform for two years running. Vlocity is currently shipping version 18 of its application suite, and has raised over $100MM in capital from investors including Salesforce.com, Accenture and Sutter Hill Ventures.

Vlocity develops software to help communications, media & energy providers, insurance carriers and government agencies digitally engage customers through their channels and devices of choice. We serve dozens of the world’s Fortune 5000 companies including Sky Italia, Telecom Italia, TELUS, 3, Telecom Argentina, Cellcom, New York Life, Farmers Insurance, Harvard Pilgrim, and Anthem. Our solutions run on our customers’ web sites, in their contact centers and on the mobile devices of their service and sales professionals – providing a compelling, modern, omnichannel experience. Despite the complexity and sophistication of the enterprise business processes we enable, we believe the user experience should be as simple and compelling as a consumer application.

Job Description

Our Presales Solution Consultants are hands-on experts with Vlocity's industry applications. Working with account executives, your role will be to understand our customer’s business outcomes, and explain how Vlocity applications can help to achieve them.

You’ll work with large, global companies, responding to RFx’s, discovering their business needs, building demonstrations / proof of concepts (POCs) and delivering value based demonstrations to business and IT stakeholders.

You’ll be an experienced pre-sales professional who is as comfortable presenting systems architecture to rooms of enterprise architects, as you are explaining the business value of Vlocity to C-level execs.

We are looking for professionals who want to join an exciting, fast paced environment where your expertise and experience enables you to manage competing requests for your time.

This is your opportunity to be part of a team where you make a difference in winning and losing deals, working for a multi-award winning company (Forbes Cloud 100, ComputerWorld Best Places to Work, LightReading Company of the Year, JMP Securities “Hot 100”).

Responsibilities
  • Own the end-to-end presales cycle including discovery, responding to RFx’s, building and delivering product demonstrations, etc.
  • Build and maintain relationships with IT and business stakeholders
  • Write responses to RFx’s, sales and architecture presentations
  • Build business relevant demonstrations of Vlocity applications
  • Capture product enhancements and work with Product Management to prioritize them
  • Contribute to building a positive, can-do, high-performance culture
  • Travel to customer sites in EMEA


Experience
  • Fluency in English required, excellent all round communication skills
  • Designing and debating enterprise integration architecture
  • Collaboration with geographically distributed teams
  • Industry experience in any of our verticals is preferred
  • Configuration of Salesforce.com or similar applications (Siebel, SAP, Amdocs, Oracle, Microsoft, Netsuite, etc.) is preferred
  • Working within a fast-paced sales environment
  • Working with SaaS software such as Salesforce.com, Netsuite, Workday, etc.
  • Willingness to travel in EMEA and sometimes beyond


Technical Skills
  • Experience of enterprise architecture principles in SaaS and on-premise environments, e.g. SOA, compliance, security, etc.
  • Web languages including HTML, CSS, JavaScript, etc.
  • JavaScript skills and modern frameworks, Angular, JQuery, Backbone.js or similar
  • Must be comfortable working with structured data interchange formats including JSON and XML
  • Salesforce certification to ADM201 and DEV401 is preferred
  • Technical proficiency with Salesforce.com development languages such as Apex, Visualforce, Lightning, etc. is preferred
  • Web services based integration using SOAP, REST, OAuth, etc.

Job description

Casual position



St Michael’s Grammar School is one of the leading co-educational, independent schools in Australia, providing exceptional learning opportunities to students from Kindergarten to Year 12. St Michael’s Grammar School was established by the Anglican Community of the Sisters of the Church on its current site in 1895.



St Michael’s Grammar School is renowned for its excellence in teaching and learning, diverse community, and creative and caring environment. The St Michael’s Grammar School community is united by strong values based on respect for self and others, wellbeing, autonomous thinking and expression, and meaningful connections with local and international communities.



We are looking for a committed Out of School Care Assistant to contribute to the provision of quality care and innovative, age appropriate programs for Years Prep-6. The Out of School Care Assistant will lead the planning and implementation of the Before School Care program and work towards an effective and collaborative OSC team, where individuals are encouraged to share and discuss ideas and approaches. You must be aligned with the School’s ethos, vision and values. You are curious, excited and invigorated by learning and are a continuous, autonomous learner who makes visible their own learning. You will possess a positive outlook, exceptional interpersonal skills and high emotional intelligence with demonstrated ability to build authentic, collaborative relationships.



The successful applicant will:



  • Have a Diploma in Children’s Services or a higher qualification

  • Display a genuine interest in and respect for all children

  • Be familiar with the National Quality Standards

  • Be willing to be involved in all aspects of the School’s program

  • Display a genuine interest in and respect for all children

  • Possess strong interpersonal skills, with the ability to build rapport and interact with both adults and students

  • Have high level communication skills

  • Work independently but also as part of a dynamic, creative and collaborative team.

  • Have a current Working with Children check or be willing to obtain prior to commencement

  • Have a current Level II First Aid and CPR Certificate, Anaphylaxis Management Certificate and an Asthma Management certificate or willing to obtain prior to commencement

  • Have a current National Police Check or be willing to obtain prior to commencement



This is a casual position commencing immediately. Due to the casual nature of this position, please note that the hours required will be based on the operational requirements of the School. This may include working in Before School Care, Out of School Care or during the Holiday Program.



Key benefits of working at St Michael’s Grammar School include.



  • Competitive salaries

  • 10% superannuation

  • Staff health and wellbeing program

  • Social and fun team activities

  • Stimulating working environment (progressive, fast-paced)

  • On-site cafeteria with barista-made coffee

  • Pool and gym available for staff use

  • Innovative learning environment

  • Culture of celebrating success



St Michael’s Grammar School is committed to child safety. As such, the successful applicant will be expected to satisfy child protection screening, and adhere to the School’s Child Safe Policy and Code of Conduct. These documents may be downloaded from the Schools website.



For more information, please see the position description below.



If this sounds like the role you’ve been waiting for ’APPLY NOW’.



Please submit your details, resume and cover letter outlining in detail your experience and ability to meet the requirements of this role. Please note that applications without cover letters will not be considered.



If you would like to discuss this role, please contact Miss Anna Borovska, People and Strategy Officer, on 03 8530 3341.

Online Hiring Events are live forums designed to enable you to understand the role and requirements through an interactive Q&A session followed by a self-directed testing process. The testing takes between 3-5 hours to complete. It’s worth taking the time to finish all the tests because we evaluate every single complete application to find the top talent.

This event will include all testing required to apply for the role. Upon grading the tests, and if you advance, we will set up an interview with the hiring manager.

As a Chief Software Architect, it is your responsibility to ensure that customers are blown away by technical differentiation and the quality of our products.

We want to give you the ability to look at code in ways it has never been looked at before, to understand the interdependency in the code.

We are innovating software development and creating higher quality code by using the latest technologies and toolsets. We are driven by using data to make decisions and bring big data and analysis to software development. We are pioneers in software development and innovate improvements in the newest technologies.

We want people who are adaptable and can learn new things, bringing fresh new ideas and concepts to solve complex business problems.

Expectations
  • Develop expertise in one or more of our proprietary enterprise software products.
  • Leverage your broad technology capability to lead and inspire the use of various technologies to architect, develop, and iteratively deploy real enterprise class software.

Candidate Requirements
  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Electrical Engineering
  • 8+ years of experience as a software engineer in C#.net
  • 4+ years experience working in an environment where CI/ CD tools are used
  • Have a minimum of 2 years experience leading or mentoring other more junior developers
  • 2+ years experience in writing unit tests
  • Experienced using Jira and Git
  • Proficiency in the following skills and technologies is mandatory:
  • Database knowledge in technology such as SQL Server/Oracle/MySQL/MongoDB/Cassandra SOA, EDA, and Design patterns
  • Javascript (ReactJS, AngularJS) , HTML5, CSS3
  • Some experience in Linux, Django, REST and shell scripting
  • MVC and knowledge of another server-side programming language (Ruby, PHP) is desired but not mandatory
  • Demonstrate success as a problem solver
  • Be a results-oriented individual
  • Comfortable “working virtually” with teammates and customers around the world
  • Good proficiency in the English language
  • Has worked with back-end technologies and latest development frameworks

    • Bootcamp Program

    As a candidate for this position, you are invited to take part in a paid training program led by our best-in-class teams, on best-in-class technologies in our 4-week Bootcamp program.

    After grading your tests, you will be eligible to take the Bootcamp which is usually held within a week of obtaining your test results. You will be paid the full-time rate for 40 hours per week for four weeks.

    Once the Bootcamp tests are complete, we will be able to evaluate you for the position correctly. Taking the Bootcamp doesn’t guarantee that you will be hired, but you will learn everything you'll need to be successful in the role as part of the hiring process.

    Crossover is redefining the way people work. A future where all high-skill jobs go to the cloud and big-data is used to help individuals and teams become more and more productive. Brick and mortar offices are history. The future of our workforce is global and will be built from teams collaborating from every corner of the world. We have embarked on an expedition to find and engage with that talent and are now in over 108 different countries. Crossover has developed a unique method of finding, curating, and managing cloud talent. Our platform connects customers to the world’s best people for both technical and non-technical jobs. But we don’t just find the best, we also provide the tools, training, and relationship building support to ensure success for long term growth.

Seniority Level

Associate

  • Computer Software
  • Internet
  • Information Technology and Services

Full-time

  • Engineering
  • Consulting

839547286:
[

Senior Coordinator Startup Programs

Company Name RMIT University Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 76 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Senior Coordinator Startup Programs
Job no: 568318
Work type: Full time - Fixed term/Contract
Categories: Education
  • Convenient CBD Location
  • Full-Time, Fixed-Term 12 month position
  • $95,965 - $107,770 p.a + superannuation

Our Organisation

RMIT is a global university of technology, design and enterprise. Our mission is to help shape the world through research, innovation, teaching and engagement, and to create transformative experiences for our students, getting them ready for life and work.

RMIT Activator is the cornerstone of entrepreneurship and enterprise at RMIT and part of how we bring to life key elements of RMIT’s strategy of Ready for Life and Work. We seek to help every graduate ready for life and work and through engaging with industry, make industry a real experience for our students.

In 2018, we are focussing on 3 areas: Building entrepreneurial mindsets and work ready skills; Forming enterprises; and Connecting internal and external networks.

The Role And Your Responsibilities

RMIT Activator is the University’s hub for entrepreneurship support. Activator is looking for a highly motivated person to fill the role of Senior Coordinator Startup Programs. This person will be the key relationship manager of all teams participating in Activator’s startup programs. Their role is to manage the full lifecycle of the program from recruitment and selection through to managing the teams’ progress through both the pre-accelerator and accelerator program, and supporting the teams to transition into next steps beyond the program.

Working in an energetic, face-paced environment, the Senior Coordinator Startup Programs will be the first point of contact for all entrepreneurs engaging with Activator who have an idea to explore, and will provide follow on “office hours” consultations to support appropriate next steps through the programs. You will drive out accountability for achieving progress and establish connectivity to relevant learning, advisory, peer and mentoring support to help achieve their goals. In addition, the role includes facilitation of workshops and presentations across topics relevant to early stage startups.

Skills & Experience Required

The successful candidate will have a relevant tertiary education that demonstrates skills in commercialisation, lean business development, business startups and growth. You will have demonstrated expertise in dealing with and understanding the fundamental skills required within a business start-up environment to launch, grow and secure funding. You will have active networks and ongoing participation in the startup ecosystem and have the ability to plan and manage in a fast-paced environment.

Experience in providing coaching services to start-ups and SMEs, having your own business/startup, as well as facilitation skills will also be highly valued.

To Apply

For further information please contact Julie Stevens, Partnerships & Commercial Manager, Activator on +61 3 9925 4727 or to view a position description visit yourcareer.rmit.edu.au and search using job reference number 568318.

Applications close on Wednesday 12th September 2018.

Position Description - Senior Coordinator Startup Programs.pdf

Applicants are requested to separately address the key selection criteria as outlined in the Position Description. This role will require satisfactory confirmation of a Working with Children Check.

RMIT is an equal opportunity employer committed to being a child safe organisation. We are dedicated to attracting, retaining and developing our people regardless of gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability and age. Applications are encouraged from all sectors of the community.

Application close: 12 Sep 2018 11:55 PM AUS Eastern Standard Time

Social Media and Content Manager

Company Name frank green Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 336 views

Job description

SOCIAL MEDIA + CONTENT MANAGER


At frank green we want to change the world. No, really - we do. We want to motivate a change in how you think, feel and (most importantly) do, regarding sustainable living. \xa0We want to help reduce the waste we are leaving for generations to come and believe prevention is better than cure.

\xa0

If that's something you feel passionate about, we have an opportunity for a highly creative, results driven Social Media and Content Manager to join our team. Working directly with the Head of Digital & Marketing you will contribute to the social media and content strategy of the frank green business, while creating innovative and engaging content each day that resonates with our loyal community, across our multiple platforms, both on and offsite.

\xa0

This role will allow you to explore your creativity and try new things all while capturing the beautiful aesthetic and innovative and sustainable nature of the frank green brand and product range.

\xa0

The successful Social Media and Content Manager will have a proven track record of creating engaging content and managing communities in either a lifestyle, sustainability or design industry.

\xa0

\xa0


ABOUT THE ROLE:

\xa0

Working across our global brand, you will be responsible for:

\xa0

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Content creation for all frank green online media channels, including (but not limited to) Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn, YouTube, Twitter and EDMs.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Editorial responsibility for the frank green blog and press channels on frankgreen.com, both locally and across our international presences.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Customer service support (direct dialogue with consumers across our social channels).

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Development, execution and optimisation of the frank green social media strategy.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Campaign management from ideation through to generation and execution.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Weekly reporting of social and traffic KPI’s.


\xa0

To be successful in this role you will:


\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Ideally have 5+ years' experience in content creation and community management \xa0

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Have demonstrated experience in writing rich and engaging content for an international brand

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Be mature, self-motivated and have the ability to take initiative

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Have high attention to detail with the ability to self check

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Love working in a challenging, dynamic environment

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Are an autonomous self-starter who knows how to get things done

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Want to work in a team and collaborate with others

\xa0

The below skills and traits will be highly regarded:


\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Graphic design skills/experience (Adobe Creative Suite or Canva)

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Big picture thinker who is well travelled.\xa0 Bonus points if you've worked in either the US or UK markets.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Understanding of people and the world’s challenges

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 A cross section of experience across client side and agency


\xa0

This is an opportunity for someone who can work in a fast-paced environment and get their hands dirty to get the job done.

\xa0

In exchange for your hard work, we’ll offer you autonomy and a supportive ‘anything is possible’ culture in our South Melbourne office.

\xa0

If this sounds like you, please send your CV, an example of your work and cover letter to hello@frankgreen.com.au.

\xa0




WE’RE FRANK GREEN, DESIGNED FOR HUMANITY.

At frank green, we want to change the way people think about reusable products. It’s our mission to motivate them to live more sustainably and reduce unnecessary waste.

frank green’s philosophy is to design stylish, innovative products – because we believe everyday products should be beautiful, functional and good for the environment.

\xa0

Our team culture is dynamic, fast-paced and high performing. We aren’t afraid of change and believe that anything is possible. We love being pushed outside our comfort zone and being challenged. We’re always innovating, looking for any opportunity to put our customers first. We’re also a super friendly bunch who love coffee - our office is a short walk to Clarendon Street, with easy access to public transport.

\xa0

frank green’s mission is to stop the devastating environmental impact of single-use products.
